concept.title: Switch Core App Types
concept.shortdesc: Learn how to change from one conversation App type to another.

conbody.p: Lifefyre allows you to change Collections from one Livefyre Core Application type to another (Comments, Live Blog, or Chat) by simply changing some settings in your collectionMeta data.

To implement a specific type of App, add a new field to your collectionMeta object. Comments is the default so you wonâ€™t need to make these updates if that is your desired App. To change to a different App after a Collection has been created, pass a checksum value during App initialization. Read more about creating a checksum value in our collectionMeta token documentation.

section.title: Live Blog
section.codeblock:
from livefyre import Livefyre
article_id = "1" article_title = "Title 1" article_url = "http://dev.livefyre.com" article_tags = "tag1,tag2" lf_type = "livecomments"
network = Livefyre.get_network(networkName, networkKey) site = network.get_site(siteId, siteKey)
collection_meta = site.build_collection_meta_token( article_title, article_url, article_tags, lf_type, )
conv_config = dict( "el" = "targetElement", "checksum" = checksum, "collectionMeta" = collection_meta_token, "siteId" = <YOUR SITE ID>, "articleId" = <ARTICLE ID> )

require 'livefyre' article_id = "1" title = "Title 1" link = "http://dev.livefyre.com" tag_str = "tag1,tag2" lf_type = "livecomments"
network = Livefyre.get_network(networkName, networkKey) site = network.get_site(siteId, siteKey)
collection_meta = site.build_collection_meta_token( title, link, tag_str || "", lf_type, )
conv_config = { :el => targetElement, :checksum => checksum, :collectionMeta => collection_meta_token, :siteId => <YOUR SITE ID>, :articleId => <ARTICLE ID> }
